text: Nancy Sue Wilson (February 20, 1937 - December 13, 2018) was an American jazz singer and actress. Her career began in 1950 and she retired in 2011. She was born in Chillicothe, Ohio. Wilson won three Grammy Awards for her recordings. She was known as "Sweet Nancy", "The Baby", "Fancy Miss Nancy" and "The Girl With the Honey-Coated Voice". Her best known works were "(You Don't Know) How Glad I Am", "I Wanna Be With You", and "Uptight (Everything's Alright)". Wilson died from kidney cancer on December 13, 2018, at her home in Pioneertown, California at the age of 81. ==References== ==Other websites== * * [ Billboard Chart History for Nancy Wilson] * * NEA Jazz Masters: Nancy Wilson â€“ Biography and Interview Category:American Grammy Award winners Category:1937 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from kidney cancer Category:Cancer deaths in California Category:American jazz singers Category:American blues singers Category:American R&B; singers Category:American pop singers Category:American soul singers Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:Actors from Ohio Category:Singers from Ohio
title: Nancy Wilson (jazz singer)
